name: places/ChIJz4iY2r9ZwokRkcung6Jd6bs

displayName.text: THE HOME HOTEL POWERED BY LUXURBAN

adrFormatAddress: 765 8th Ave, New York, NY 10036, USA

originalText.text:
My stay was a sublime experience. The hotel effortlessly balances central location with tranquility, offering a peaceful oasis in the midst of the city.

The bathroom deserves special mention - a sleek and modern haven of luxury. The shower was a delight, and the attention to detail was impeccable. Fluffy towels and premium toiletries added a touch of indulgence.

What truly set The Home apart was its commitment to silence. Not a hint of external noise disturbed my stay, ensuring a restful night's sleep.

The staff was courteous and attentive, enhancing the overall experience. In summary, highly recommended!

originalText.text: There is great potential...Pros - conveniently located, rooms appointed with creative storage for a small space, most affordable I could find in the area, clean, styled nicely  Cons - no ice machine, some advertised amenities were NOT available, including the TV (out of operation for weeks, we were told), individually temperature-controlled rooms (not true - it was too hot and we had no way of adjusting the temp).  The only lighting is the bright ceiling lights, as the bedside lights were missing/removed, leaving, only an on/off switch that did nothing.   The phone at the front desk was apparently on silent, so we had to hoof down and up 5 flights of stairs to speak to an employee because no one answered the phone. The fifth floor walkup was okay, because I had read reviews indicating there was no elevator, but it should be made clear in any advertising of the hotel.  I would consider another stay there again, knowing that the management/ownership recently changed, giving the belief that things will continue to improve.

originalText.text: This hotel is great. Not in Chinatown, by the way, but a cool mural type art on the wall. The location is great. Yes, there is noise, but I have been to NYC many times, and only a couple of hotels didn't have much noise. I also paid 300-400 a night. When we arrived at 2 am. due to flight delays, the gentleman at the desk was awesome, super nice.  Rooms are clean, shower is hot, tvs didn't work but I dont come to the city to watch TV. Would stay at this hotel again and again. Oh, there is no elevator. Just be prepared but not the end of the world.

originalText.text: Unhealthy and unsafe. I booked this hotel due to a miscommunication and it ended up being a mistake in more ways than one. I could write several paragraphs about the lack of soundproofing, faulty and insufficient electrical outlets, broken climate controls, busted tv service, and the room’s basic lack of functionality for a weekend in the city. But I will let these pictures of the enormous cockroach climbing around the bathroom do the work for me. Avoid this hotel.

originalText.text:
Before you book at this hotel or any by LuxUrban carefully consider the health and wellbeing of yourself and other guests as the this hotel chain will not. We booked five nights in NYC over the thanksgiving weekend. Because of the limited availability, the only rooms offered were non-refundable. Not feeling comfortable with this, I called the hotel and was told that in the case of a verifiable emergency, a refund would be provided.
Two days before our trip our party got sick with Covid 19 which is verified. In an effort to protect others and prevent spreading the virus, we reached out to the hotel to cancel or change  our reservation. First, no one ever answers and the phone always goes directly to voicemail. Someone finally responded via text wishing us a speedy recovery but denying any type of credit or refund. When asked if they preferred guests to arrive with Covid, no response was offered.
From a growing brand I am disappointed in such poor service and communication of policy. I acknowledge that I should have gotten the emergency refund in writing but I am genuinely concerned that so little consideration is given to the health of all guests and staff. We will never book with you again and will ensure that we let others know of the abhorrent policies, communication, and regard.
